title: eva_00
body:
A [[mecha]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], piloted by [[Ayanami Rei]].

[b]Eva-00[/b] was the first operational Evangelion. Being a prototype, it was not originally equipped for combat, but was later upgraded and brought into battle against the [[Angel (Evangelion)|Angels]].

Eva-00 is the most unstable of the Evangelions, going wildly berserk on two occasions: once during its activation experiment with Rei, and again during its interchangeability experiment with [[Ikari Shinji|Shinji]]. Despite these incidents, Rei retains good control over the Eva once it is operational, using it successfully in quite sensitive tasks such as handling the [[Lance of Longinus (Evangelion)|]] on two occasions, and both fetching and firing the SDF's positron cannon.

Designed in [[real life]] by [[Yamashita Ikuto]] during the 90s.
other_names: エヴァンゲリオン零号機

title: eva_02
body:
A [[Evangelion (mecha)|]], piloted by [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]].

Unit-02 is predominantly red with orange highlights, and possesses [[multiple eyes|four]] small [[green eyes]]. Designed in [[real life]] by [[Yamashita Ikuto]] during the 90s.

[spoiler]The unit was once piloted by [[Makinami Mari Illustrious]], who displayed the hidden "Beast Mode" that purged cylinders from all over the unit and caused it to open up a gigantic maw.[/spoiler]
other_names: エヴァンゲリオン弐号機
エヴァンゲリオン2号機

title: eva_01
body:
(エヴァしょごうき, [i]EVA Shogouki[/i])

A [[mecha]] in [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], piloted by [[Ikari Shinji]]. 

Arguably the most famous [[evangelion_(mecha)|Evangelion unit]], [b]EVA-01[/b] has a predominantly purple body with neon green highlights, yellowish eyes and a characteristic [[single horn]] that distinguishes it from the other EVAs. Designed in [[real life]] by [[Yamashita Ikuto]] during the 90s.

[spoiler]It has the hidden ability to go berserk, in which case its eyes glow red and a large mouth opens itself from the Evangelion's faceplate. In [[Evangelion: 2.0 You Can (Not) Advance]], the unit undergoes a process called "Pseudo-Evolution" after devouring [[Zeruel (evangelion)|]], where its green highlights become red and a shining [[halo]] materialises around the horn. In this form, the unit's left arm may or may not be a glowing construct.

In the original series it is revealed that [[Ikari Yui]]'s essence fused with the mecha during a pilot test, turning it into Shinji's actual mother.[/spoiler]
other_names: エヴァンゲリオン初号機

title: brobo
body:
An obscure character from the [[Kirby (series)|]] series, which makes its first and only appearance as an enemy in [[Kirby's Block Ball]]. It is a circular creature that wears a [[robot]]-like armor.

Brobo would not feature in another game until [[Kirby: Star Allies]], where it makes a cameo along with [[Gryll (kirby)|]] as a rare [[stone_kirby|Stone]] transformation.

title: callie_(splatoon)
body:
[[splatoon_(series)|Splatoon]] character. Named [b]Aori[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[inkling]].

She is part of an [[idol]] group known as Squid Sisters (Sea O'Colors in the Japanese version) with the other member being her [[cousins|cousin]], [[Marie (splatoon)|]]. She and Marie are also both news program hostesses that announce in-game news.

She wears a purple and black-themed outfit matching Marie's and [[sushi]] [[food on head|on her head]]. Other features of this default costume & appearance include [[bow-shaped hair]] and a [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]]. In general she is usually depicted with a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]], [[thick eyebrows]] and [[star-shaped pupils]].

Her canonical [[list of weapons in splatoon|weapon]] class of choice are Rollers.

Her Japanese name comes from the Japanese word for the "bigfin reef squid":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bigfin_reef_squid (障泥烏賊/アオリイカ [i]Aori-ika[/i]) and their band's name in Japanese is a portmanteau of "shiokara" (a Japanese food made out of various marine animals, commonly squid) and "colors". Callie and Marie's names in English are a play on the word calamari.

title: marie_(splatoon)
body:
[[splatoon_(series)|Splatoon]] character. Named [b]Hotaru[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[inkling]].

She is part of an [[idol]] group known as Squid Sisters (Sea O' Colors in the Japanese release) with the other member being her [[cousins|cousin]] [[Callie (splatoon)|]]. She and Callie are also both news program hostesses that announce in-game news.

She wears a green and black-themed outfit matching Callie's and wears a food cup on her head. Other features of this default costume & appearance include [[bow-shaped hair]] and a [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]]. In general she is usually depicted with a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]], [[thick eyebrows]] and [[star-shaped pupils]].

Her canonical [[list of weapons in splatoon|weapon]] class of choice are Chargers.

Often drawn with a more melancholic expression compared to her cousin. 

Her Japanese name comes from the Japanese word for the "firefly squid":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watasenia_scintillans (蛍烏賊/ホタルイカ [i]Hotaru-ika[/i]) and their band's name in Japanese is a portmanteau of "shiokara" (a Japanese food made out of various marine animals, commonly squid) and "colors". She and Callie's names in English are a play on the word calamari.

title: loose_hair_strand
body:
Single strands of hair that are drawn out of place, separated from the rest of the hair.

Sometimes, this is an element of [[messy hair]] or [[floating hair]] where a clean hairstyle is disrupted, but can also appear on the periphery of otherwise orderly hair, or in front of a character's face, as with many cases where a [[hair in own mouth|strand of hair is stuck to one's mouth]], or ahead of the bulk of the hair as a distinct loose stroke.

Note that this tag is only for single strands of hair, these will be usually drawn in a single stroke, either in black, white, or a shade of the color of the hair.  It is [b]not[/b] for bundles, spikes, wedges, or clumps of hair. It is [b]not [/b]for [[ahoge]], [[antenna hair]], [[cowlick]]s, [[sidelocks]], or the like. For those, be sure to include the appropriate tag. If a bit of hair has a distinct border of another color, or a significant width or taper, it is almost certainly not applicable for this tag.

Although they might be drawn similarly, this is also [b]not[/b] for [[stray pubic hair]], or [[body hair]].

Note that this phenomenon is often very hard or impossible to see in thumbnails, be cautious when gardening this tag.

h4. Examples

* !post #7020568
* !post #9178468

h4. See also

* [[lone nape hair]]
* [[tag group:hair]]

Not to be confused with:

title: sensei_(blue_archive)
body:

They are of unspecified gender, though for the game's [[Blue Archive the Animation|anime adaptation]], the player character is [[Sensei (Blue Archive the Animation)|a male]]. 
 
Occasionally drawn resembling [[doodle sensei (blue archive)|a male doodle]] seen in an "episode":[https://youtu.be/9y_AhGXxHBU?t=98] of [[Arona (blue archive)|]] Channel and post #5944539. He later received [[sensei (blue archive the animation)|a proper appearance]] in [[Blue Archive the Animation]].

title: scarlet_ibis_(kemono_friends)
body:
A type of avian Friend that has appeared in all [[Kemono Friends]] media to date.

Scarlet Ibis dresses in a [[long coat|long]], [[red coat]] with a puffy, feather-like collar and matching sleeves. She wears a [[pink skirt]] with peach-coloured [[thighhighs]], and also dons a pair of [[red shoes|ruby-red]] [[Mary Janes]]. Scarlet Ibis' hair is predictably [[red hair|scarlet]], with [[black hair|black]] tips on either end of the long hair locks hanging from her bangs. This colouration closely resembles the beak of the actual bird. Her hair is tied in the back in two thin [[short twintails|pigtail]]s, and a pair of tiny, [[multicolored wings|four-tone]] [[wings]] protrude [[head wings|from her head]]. She has a feathery tail with black tips. Her eyes are a garnet red.

While still four-toned, Scarlet Ibis' wing tips were originally white in colouration rather than black. In addition, she wore [[black shoes]] and apparently used different [[hair tie]]s to hold her pigtails together. Rather than thigh-high stockings, she wore full [[leggings]]. Notably, her eyes are [[grey eyes|grey]].
other_names: ショウジョウトキ(けものフレンズ)

title: kamen_rider
body:
[b]Kamen Rider[/b] (仮面ライダー), also known as Masked Rider, is a Japanese [[tokusatsu]] franchise created by [[Ishinomori Shoutarou]].

The plot generally involves at least one main character who possesses the ability to transform and does battle with monsters and organizations that are somehow related to his origin.

Riders are typically identified by their insect-like features such as their compound eyes and antenna. Other visual cues include intricate belts, motorcycles, [[henshin]] poses, scarves, and the signature finisher, the Rider Kick.

title: cave_divers_(meme)
body:
A meme popularised in Tiktok and Instagram in 2025, based on the hobby of cave exploration. It usually shows either a pair of feet sticking out of a hole, or a silhouette of a spelunker stuck upside down in a narrow hole (based on the death of John Edward Jones in [[Nutty Putty Cave]]).

It should be noted that the name is misleading, as cave diving refers specifically to exploring underwater caves.

title: cavalry_helmet
body:
A type of metal [[helmet]] traditionally worn by [[cavalry]] units (horse-mounted soldiers), prominent especially in European armies during the 19th and early 20th centuries. Also known as the [b]Albert helmet[/b], named after Prince Albert, consort to Queen Victoria.

h1. Characteristics:
These helmets are typically made of polished metal (brass, steel, or German silver). Defining features often include:
* A prominent metal crest or comb running front-to-back (distinguishing it from the typically simpler spike of many [[pickelhaube]] designs), although some versions did incorporate spikes.
* A decorative front plate, often bearing a regimental or national emblem.
* Often fitted with elaborate chin scales or a chinstrap.
* May feature a plume holder for attaching a horsehair or feather [[plume]] for parade dress.

It is distinct from the [[pickelhaube]] (though some cavalry units wore Pickelhauben) and the [[shako_cap|shako]]. While historically accurate for cavalry, similar designs may appear in fantasy or fictional military settings.

h1. See also:
[[Chin Strap]]
[[Pickelhaube]] (Often confused with or related; Pickelhauben are typically associated more with infantry, often made of leather/felt, and defined by a spike)
[[shako_cap|Shako]] (Another type of historical military headwear)

title: jaiden_animations
body:
Animator and YouTuber, known for her story-time animations, which explore a variety of topics, spanning from personal experiences (such as her being aroace) to video games (including her various Pokémon videos).

On December 1st, 2022, she "debuted":https://twitter.com/jaidenanimation/status/1598398696999497728 a [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] model, and is a member of the group [[WILD/CARD]].

Played a character on [[Quackity SMP]] for a short while, raising two adopted egg children, [[Bobby (quackity smp)|]] and [[Empanada (quackity smp)|]]. [spoiler]Her character would not survive the nuclear bomb planted on Quesadilla Island by [[AgenteMaxo]][/spoiler], the in-universe explanation given by her when she decided to depart from the server.

[i]Pokémon: Let's Go, Pikachu![/i] and [i]Pokémon: Let's Go, Eevee![/i].

A pair of [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] games for the [[Nintendo Switch]]. Focusing on the original Kanto Pokémon, the duology serves as a collective remake of [[pokemon rgby|Pokémon Yellow]] with the ability to connect to [[pokemon go|Pokémon GO]] intended to bridge the gap between GO and the main series for new and lapsed players.

title: nutty_putty_cave
body:
The [b]Nutty Putty Cave[/b] is a hydrothermal cave in Utah County, Utah. Infamous for causing the death of John Edward Jones (leading to the cave's sealing with concrete in 2009); diagrams of the "Birth Canal" passage which Jones got wedged in were incorporated into the [[cave divers (meme)|]] meme in the early 2020's.
h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Nutty Putty Cave":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nutty_Putty_Cave

title: zanneck
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZMT-S29 Zanneck[/b]

A psycommu-enabled prototype unit by BESPA ([[Zanscare]] Imperial Army) that was fielded near the end of the Zanscare War. The Zanneck's mega beam cannon can hit targets on Earth from high in the atmosphere, or across long distances in [[space]]. The blast from this beam cannon could only be deflected by the LM314V21 [[V2 Gundam]]'s mega beam [[shield]] or its wings of light.

To compensate for the [[mobile suit]]'s low mobility when using its beam cannon, a large flight support system known as Zanneck Base was developed for its use. The Zanneck's cockpit has two seats for a pilot and a gunner.

title: goddess_of_victory:_nikke
body:
A Korean mobile third-person shooter role-playing game, developed by Shift Up and published by Level Infinite, a subsidiary of Tencent. Development began as early as 2017 and being officially released on November 4, 2022 for Android and iOS, and on February 15, 2023 for the PC port.

Players are put into the shoes of a [[commander (nikke)|]] of advanced androids called "Nikkes" and are tasked with fighting back against [[Rapture (nikke)|Raptures]], mysterious robotic organisms that have driven humanity underground following a devastating war, and reclaiming the surface.

One of the popular abbreviations for the game's title in Japanese is メガニケ (MegaNikke; with mega being the short for 女神, megami).

title: oekaki
body:
A drawing made with very simple tools, usually imageboard/bbs-embedded drawing software, with [[jaggy lines|very sharp and thin lines]].

Oekaki (お絵描き) is Japanese for "scribble" or "doodle". On the Internet, an Oekaki is a message board system that revolves around computer art created by a local art program. Oekaki artists often post their art to other websites, such as personal pages or free gallery websites, in addition to the original board.

h4. See also

* [[stickam]]
* [[tegaki]]

title: nekomata
body:
A [[traditional youkai]] in the form of a cat or cat-like spirit with [[two tails]].

A nekomata can be humanoid or a [[cat]].

Note that in some cases, the tail is forked while still technically counting as one tail, so the tag combination would be [[nekomata]] + [[forked tail]], excluding [[multiple tails]] / [[two tails]].

title: shinsengumi
body:
Shinsengumi was a special [[police]] force which performed counter-terrorism in [[Kyoto]] for the Tokugawa shogunate in the late Shogunate period.

They were characterized with harsh discipline and their unique [[uniform]]s. Their [[haori]] were colored light blue, and the sleeves were trimmed with white [i]dandara-moyou[/i] (mountain stripes).

h4. Members of the Shinsengumi

title: cliffheart_(arknights)
body:
[i]Cliffheart, Specialist Operator of Rhodes Island, possesses both the tenacity of a climber and the sensitivity of a warrior[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Encia Silverash

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]

      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kjerag[/td][/tr]

She  is the youngest of the Silverash siblings, being the younger sister of both [[pramanix_(arknights)|Enya "Pramanix" Silverash]] and [[silverash_(arknights)|Enciodas Silverash]]. She was sent to Rhodes Island by her brother in order to treat her Oripathy. She is a specialist in rock and mountain climbing and is proficient with all kinds of climbing tools.

Just like her siblings, her motif is based on the snow leopard.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[shiraishi ryouko|Ryoko Shiraishi]].

title: hormone_replacement_therapy
body:
Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) is a form of hormone therapy that uses sex hormones and other hormonal medications for [[gender transitioning]]. This form of hormone therapy is given as one of two types, based on whether the goal of treatment is masculinization or feminization:

* Masculinizing hormone therapy – for transgender men or transmasculine people; consists of androgens and occasionally antiestrogens.
* Feminizing hormone therapy – for transgender women or transfeminine people; consists of estrogens with or without antiandrogens.

Non-binary people may also engage in hormone therapy in order to achieve a desired balance of sex hormones or to help align their bodies with their gender identities. Many transgender people obtain hormone therapy from a licensed health care provider and others obtain and self-administer hormones.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gender-affirming_hormone_therapy

title: touhou_puppet_play
body:
Touhou Ningyougeki (東方人形劇, lit. "Touhou Puppet Play"), commonly localized to Touhoumon, is a series of ROM Hacks and Fan Games that modify various Pokémon games into a Touhou-esque theme, where you can capture and battle with Puppets that represent the various Touhou characters. The primary ones, released by the developer HemoglobinA1C, are a series of Pokémon FireRed ROM hacks. Though Hemo would go on to form FocasLens, which would develop the spiritual successor to the Touhou Puppet Play ROM hacks, known as Gensou Ningyou Enbu, localized in the west as Touhou Puppet Dance Performance, there are still derivatives of the initial ROM Hack series that exist and continue to be made to date. 

It also Inspired [[gensou_ningyou_enbu|Touhou Puppet Dance Performance]]

https://thpp.miraheze.org/wiki/Main_Page

title: katsuragi_izumi
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Edel Note]] from the 104th graduating class, first introduced as a first-year at [[mizukawa school uniform|Mizukawa Girls' High School]]. She joined Hasu no Sora at the start of the 105th year.

A girl with great potential that excels at everything. She became a school idol after getting scouted by [[ceras yanagida lilienfeld|Ceras]]. She loves seeing people working hard towards their dreams and can’t help but get involved.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a [[wolf cut]] and [[orange eyes]] with [[slit pupils]]. Her hair is adorned with two [[triangle hair ornament]]s.

body:

It was captured by [[Char Aznable]] along with the [[White Base]] and  upgraded by the [[Zeon|Principality of Zeon]] into the [[Red Gundam]]. Char pilots it throughout the One Year War to great effect, securing victory for Zeon.

title: minna_agechau
body:
Minna Agechau ([i]I'll Give It All to You[/i]) was an erotic comedy manga series written and illustrated by Hikaru Yuzuki, serialized in Weekly Young Jump from 1982 to 1987. Adapted into a live action film in 1985 and and OVA in 1987.

One beautiful day, Rokurou, a student, was about to masturbate when a beautiful girl knocks on his door and offers him her virginity. Her name is Yuno, a wealthy girl who wants to have sex and come of age. They move in together, becoming a couple, but are hunted as Yuno's family desperately tries to get her back.

title: yazan_gable
body:
[quote][i]"I'M GOING TO VIOLATE YOU...!!!"[/i] - Yazan Gable[/quote]

A fictional [[Gundam]] character from [[Zeta Gundam]] and [[Gundam ZZ]]. 

In [i]Zeta[/i], he's a ferocious [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[war]] maniac whose skills allow him to go at it on par with multiple powerful Newtypes like [[Kamille Bidan]] and anihilate his enemies with ease, causing the demise of several members of the [[AEUG]] [spoiler](including [[Katz Kobayashi]], [[Henken Bekkener]] and [[Emma Sheen]])[/spoiler]. 

He is most known for piloting the [[Gaplant]] and the [[Hambrabi]], from which he utters his infamous quote at Bidan. 

However, his fate drastically turns in [i]ZZ[/i], as his attempts at stealing the Zeta Gundam end up foiled repeatedly by [[Judau Ashta]], and the former ace of the Titans ends up left on the junker colony of Shangri-La, empoverished and in rags. [spoiler]A popular [[otaku|fan]] theory regarding Yazan's change in conduct explains that the long stasis inside his MS escape capsule caused permanent brain damage on him and dementia due to lack of oxygen, just like how it had happened to [[Tem Ray]] years before.[/spoiler]

title: side_slit
body:
When a dress or skirt has a cutout slit. Either single or double and in some cases, accidental through fighting.

Most [[china_dress|China dresses]] come with a side slit.

If a dress or skirt has high slits on both sides, it may form a [[pelvic curtain]].
If the slit starts at the top of the skirt and doesn't go all the way down to the bottom, use [[hip vent]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[front slit]]
* [[back slit]]
* [[cross-laced slit]]

title: ultraman
body:
The titular hero of Tsuburaya Productions's [[Ultraman (1st series)|1966-1967 tokusatsu TV series]]. His human host is [[Hayata Shin]]. Due to Ultraman becoming a title for those of the Land of Light who have protected Earth, he is often referred to with additional names to distinguish him from his Ultra Brothers, such as [i]Shodai [Ultra-]Man[/i] ("The First [Ultra-]Man"), [i][Ultra-]Man-niisan[/i] ("Brother [Ultra-]Man"), or even just [i]Man[/i], with [i]Ultraman Hayata[/i], based on his host's name, becoming a popular choice for some younger Western fans.

In the original series, Ultraman went through three main "designs":[https://qqquuu7.web.fc2.com/mans01.html] (referred to as Type A, Type B, and Type C), with Type C being the most common design used in appearances since, though with the first two being referenced from time to time. There was also a "Type D" design that existed briefly after the original series, used in stage shows, originating from converting [[Zoffy (Ultra Series)|]]'s suit back into an Ultraman suit, as his suit was originally the Type A "suit":[https://twitter.com/Killer_BleachTW/status/1647626155946807298] (previously also used by [[Imit Ultraman]], and would go on to be used for [[Ultraman Jack]]). This would all establish a trend of slight redesigns for Ultras during and "after":[https://ameblo.jp/addicto/entry-12297599543.html] their original series, as new suits are made, especially those who look similar to one another.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9070975: Type A
* !post #9070847: Type B
* !post #3924093: Type C 
* !post #7362397: [[Ultraman (Shin)|Shin]] (note the lack of a [[color timer]])

h4. See also

* [[Beta Capsule]]

h5. Copyrights

* [[Ultraman (1st series)]]
* [[Ultraman Kids]] (as [b]Maa[/b])
* [[Ultraman Chou Toushi Gekiden]] (as [b](Super) Warrior Ultraman[/b])
* [[Ultraman (Hero's comics)]] (by [[Shimizu Eiichi]] & [[Shimoguchi Tomohiro]])
* [[Ultraman THE FIRST]] (by [[Takada Yuuzou]])

h5. Characters

* [[Ultraman (Shin)|]] ([[Shin Ultraman]])
* [[Ultraman (dc)|]] ([[DC Comics]])

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ultraman":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraman_(character)

body: When the hair of a character is longer or shorter than the official length. Do not use this tag when the the different hair length has an official origin, use [[official alternate hair length]] instead. h4. See also * [[alternate hairstyle]] * [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: long_hair
body:
Hair longer than the shoulders, up to reaching the waist. Shoulder length hair should be tagged with [[medium hair]] instead. 

Some characters may have [[very long hair]], which extends past the waist, or [[absurdly long hair]], which is longer than they are tall.

h4. Examples

!post #7352787: [[short hair|"Default" (short)]], [[short hair|short]], [[medium hair|medium]], [[long hair]].

h4. Hair lengths

* [[bald]] / [[bald girl]]

* [[short hair]] (shorter than shoulder length)
* [[medium hair]] (shoulder length)
* [[long hair]] (longer than shoulder length, up to waist length)
* [[very long hair]] (longer than waist length, up to floor length)
* [[absurdly long hair]] (beyond floor length)

title: bikini
body:
A bikini is a two-piece swimsuit for women, typically comprising a bra-like top and a panty-like bottom; however, the bottom can also be in the style of a [[bikini skirt]] or [[bikini shorts]].

Bikinis come in a wide range of styles, with most designed to reveal more of the body, especially around the [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]].

The key distinguishing feature of a bikini is that it prominently exposes the [[midriff]], whereas other types of two-piece swimsuits may have a higher waistline and/or a top that extends further to cover the area. However, it's worth noting that most modern two-piece swimsuits are, in fact, bikinis.

If only the bra portion of the bikini is worn, use [[bikini top only]]. Likewise, use [[bikini bottom only]] when only the panty portion is worn. If a character's bikini top and bottom don't match, use [[mismatched bikini]].

title: rush_(mega_man)
body:
A multipurpose [[dog]] [[robot]] created to help [[Mega Man (character)|]] by [[Dr. Light (mega man)|]] and introduced in [[Mega Man 3]].

It has a [[spring]] to help Mega Man jump to hard-to-reach platforms, it can transform into a submarine to facilitate movement underwater and transform into a jet for quick stage traversal, among many other abilities.

It can also fuse with Mega Man, turning him into [[Super Mega Man (mega man)|]].

title: katsuragi_chikagi
body:
A character introduced in [[Mahou Tsukai no Hako]], and one of the mascots for [[TYPE-MOON]]'s defunct mobile website of the same name. She has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] in [[twintails]] and [[green eyes]], and is usually seen wearing the [[Kagamisaki High School Uniform]] or the [[Ahnenerbe Shop Uniform]]. Her older sister is [[Katsuragi Chidori]].

She is playable in [[Fate/Grand Order]] alongside [[Hibino Hibiki]] as the Alter Ego Servant [[Azumi-no-Isora (Fate)|]], introduced in the [[Odoru Dragon Castle!]] event. In their Third Ascension, they become [[Sirius (Fate)|]], due to Hibiki's identity as the Holy Scripture Triten.

title: hibino_hibiki
body:
A character introduced in [[Mahou Tsukai no Hako]], and one of the mascots for [[TYPE-MOON]]'s defunct mobile website of the same name. She has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[yellow eyes]], and is usually seen wearing the [[Kagamisaki High School Uniform]] or the [[Ahnenerbe Shop Uniform]].

She was originally the holy scripture [b]Triten[/b] completed by the dead apostle [[Keitai-san|Caubac Alcatraz]] in the year 1000 as his thesis on God's love. Triten ended up being a complete model of the universe, resulting in Caubac creating an inescapable labyrinth to protect it from the outside world. She inexplicably woke up one day as the human Hibiki, causing him to undergo a crisis of faith. As Hibiki, she identifies Caubac as her grandfather. Triten is [[1other|genderless]] and has [[white hair]].

She is playable in [[Fate/Grand Order]] alongside [[Katsuragi Chikagi]] as the Alter Ego Servant [[Azumi-no-Isora (Fate)|]], introduced in [[Odoru Dragon Castle!]] event. In their Third Ascension, they become [[Sirius (Fate)|]], due to Hibiki's identity as Triten.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Anmi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Honda Youko]]

title: rock_lee
body: Rock Lee (Japanese: ロック・リー) is a character in the anime and manga series [[Naruto]] and [[Naruto Shippuuden]] created by [[Kishimoto Masashi]]. At first Masashi designed Lee to symbolize human strength. In the anime and manga, Lee is a [[ninja]] affiliated with the village of Konohagakure, and is a member of Team Guy, which consists of himself, [[Hyuuga Neji]], [[Tenten (Naruto)|]], and [[Might Guy]]—the team's leader. Unable to use most ninja techniques, Lee dedicates himself to using solely taijutsu, ninja techniques similar to martial arts. Lee dreams of becoming a "splendid ninja" despite his inabilities. Lee has appeared in several pieces of Naruto media, including the third and fourth featured films in the series, the third original video animation, and multiple video games.

title: nemo_cannon
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Advance of Zeta]].

[b]MSA-003 Nemo Cannon[/b]

A long range fire support variant of the [[AEUG]] [[nemo_(mobile_suit)|Nemo]] [[mobile suit]].

It is armed with a couple of shoulder mounted [[beam cannon]]s, a [[shield]] and a [[beam rifle]].

title: nemo_(mobile_suit)
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime series and later in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

The [b]MSA-003 Nemo[/b] is a development of the [[GM_(mobile_suit)|]] line of mass production [[mobile suit]]s by [[Anaheim Electronics]] at the [[AEUG]]'s request. Since they had no experience with the GM, many parts were different, and the result was a vastly superior machine. Unlike the [[GM II]], the Nemo was constructed with Luna Titanium (or Gundarium) class alpha alloy, giving it the same armor resistance of the old [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]. 

Some elements of this MS (rear thrusters, main MS block) were also inspired by those of the [[GM Sniper II]], as several of the engineers who developed the GM SP II worked in the Nemo.

Karaba and AEUG units were painted green and blue. After The First Neo Zeon War in [[Gundam ZZ]], the remaining units were integrated into the [[Earth Federation]] forces [[gundam_unicorn|with a white and blue color scheme]].

h4.Related development
* [[Nemo Cannon]]
* [[Nemo II]]
* [[Nemo III]]

h4. See also
* [[Nero_(mobile_suit)|]]

body:
The titular [[kaiju|kaiju]] from [[godzilla (series)|Godzilla]] series. Characterized as a giant, black theropod-like creature with spine scales and long tails.

Its origin and characteristic vary in each films and media it appeared. For example, the one who appears in the original 1950 series was born as a result of the Atomic bombing on [[Hiroshima]], while the one who appears in the [i][[MonsterVerse]][/i] series was said to be an ancient creature.

title: quess_paraya
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. She first appeared in the [[Char's Counterattack]] anime film from 1988. 

[b]Quess Paraya[/b] is the rebellious teen daughter of an important [[Earth Federation]] official.

[spoilers]A powerful latent newtype who is taken in by [[Char Aznable]]'s [[Neo Zeon]] and given a [[jagd_doga_quess_custom|Jagd Doga]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] and later the [[Alpha Azieru]] [[mobile armor]]. 

During the final space battle of The Second Neo Zeon War Quess is accidentaly killed by [[Chan Agi]] (who pilots a damaged [[Re-GZ]]) while trying to protect [[Hathaway Noa]]. Then Chan is herself killed by an enraged Hathaway in a [[Jegan]]. These events would haunt Hathaway for the rest of his life and serve as catalysts for his transformation into [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]] and [[gundam_hathaway's_flash|his fight against the corrupt Earth Federation]] years later.[/spoilers]

title: mega_man_battle_network_(series)
body:
Mega Man Battle Network (known in Japan as [b]Rockman EXE[/b]) is a spin off series of [[Mega Man (series)|]] set in the year 200x.  The series spans six games across the [[Game Boy Advance]] (with certain entries also appearing on the [[Nintendo DS]]). 

Players control Lan Hikari outside of the game's net world. When it's time to jack into the net, Lan can do so by using his [[NetNavi]] MegaMan.EXE contained in a device called the PET ([[Personal Terminal]]). In the net world, players control MegaMan.EXE, protecting the web from [[virus (mega man)|]]es and villains ranging from the classic [[Lord Wily (mega man)|Wily]] to hellbent criminal organizations such as Gospel, along with new faces such as [[Dr. Regal (mega man)|]]. As MegaMan.EXE fights enemies, he can acquire their [[Battle Chip]]s, each possessing a different effect related to the defeated enemy, from powerful attacks to supporting effects such as healing or turning invisible.

After the series' sixth and final game, the Mega Man metaseries developed yet another spin off game in the form of [[Mega Man Star Force (series)|]].

h4. Recurring characters
* [[Lan Hikari (mega Man)|]]
** [[MegaMan.exe]]
* [[Mayl Sakurai (mega Man)|]]
** [[Roll.exe (mega man)|]]
* [[Eugene Chaud (mega Man)|]]
** [[Protoman.exe]]
* [[Dex Oyama (mega man)|]]
** [[Gutsman.exe]]
* [[Yai Ayanokoji (mega Man)|]]

title: tom_clancy's_the_division
body: [b]Tom Clancy's The Division[/b] is a video game series by Ubisoft and Massive Entertainment as part of the Tom Clancy line. Primarily an action RPG/looter shooter in the style of a third-person cover shooter, the series focuses on members of the classified American federal agency known as the Strategic Homeland Division - the Division, for short - with its agents activated sleeper-agent style in the case of extreme emergency to act with near-total autonomy to protect and serve. The first game takes place in the immediate wake of an act of domestic bioterrorism and viral pandemic in near-future New York City during Christmas winter, while the sequel takes place a few months later in Washington, D.C. in the summer. The aesthetic usually involves normal-looking individuals decked out with modern [[gun|guns]] and advanced tactical kit, including their signature glowing orange [[watch]], as well as use of augmented reality (AR).

Luffy|their air-headed captain]] and [[tony tony chopper|young doctor]] saw through immediately) after he was (temporarily) kicked out of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]] because of a falling-out with Luffy over the decommissioning of their first ship, the [[Going Merry]].[/spoiler]

title: cigarette_kiss
body:
The act of lighting one's own cigarette using another's cigarette, while both cigarettes are held on each person's lips. Like a [[kiss]], but with the tips of cigarettes as a proxy.

Could be romantic if done between love interests, badass if done between bros, or a tear-jerker if the cigarette is their last smoke.

Compare with [[pocky kiss]] for a more light-hearted and lung-friendly version.

h4. See Also
* [[Black Lagoon cigarette kiss]]

title: vega_(street_fighter)
body:
[b]Vega[/b], known as [b]Balrog[/b] in Japan and neutrally referred to as [b]Claw[/b] to avoid inter-regional confusion, is one of the bosses of the [[Street Fighter]] series.

He has been in the Street Fighter series ever since his debut as a boss character in [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]. He is a memorable character, not only infamous for his girl-like [[ponytail]] and battle cries, but also for the [[Claw (weapon)|]] he wields, with his unique fighting style. Vega uses his own fighting style of which is a blend of Spanish Ninjutsu and Bullfighting. 

Vega was born to a noble family in Barcelona, [[Spain]]. As he matured, Vega studied [[Bullfighting]], a cultural tradition amongst the nobles. Afterward, he went to Japan and learned Ninjutsu, a style he believed meshed well with his natural grace and agility. Returning home, Vega combined Bullfighting with Ninjutsu and went into an underground cage fighting circuit where quickly became one of the best. Tragedy struck one day when Vega witnessed the murder of his beautiful mother at the hands of his unattractive stepfather. Her murder was punishment for disrespecting him as his stepfather believed. Witnessing this tragic event warped Vega's mind and from then on he lived a double life; a suave nobleman by day and a narcissistic killer by night who enjoys mutilating ugly people to death using a three-pronged wrist-mounted razor-sharp claw. His very first victim was his stepfather.

Vega's brutal fighting skills and remorseless nature impressed the criminal leader known as [[M. Bison]] so much that he came to him personally with an offer to join Shadaloo. Vega accepted M. Bison's offer purely to improve his own aesthetic senses.
other_names: バルログ(ストリートファイター)
爪(ストリートファイター)

title: balrog_(street_fighter)
body:
[b]Balrog[/b], known as [b]M. Bison[/b] ([b]Mike Bison[/b]) in Japan and neutrally referred to as [b]Boxer[/b] to avoid inter-regional confusion, is a character from the [[Street Fighter]] series.

Balrog was once a great [[boxing]] champion and prize fighter. He was banned from boxing for permanently injuring his opponents and accidentally killing one (as well as his illegal maneuvers, particularly his headbutt), so he joined the Shadaloo criminal organization simply for monetary gain, and worked his way up from the bottom, eventually becoming [[M. Bison]]'s enforcer.
other_names: ボクサー(ストリートファイター)

title: alley
body: Otherwise known as an alleyway, a narrow lane found in urban areas, often for pedestrians only, which usually runs between or behind buildings. In older cities and towns in Europe, alleys are often what is left of a medieval street network, or a right of way or ancient footpath in an urban setting. In older urban development, alleys were built to allow for deliveries such as coal to the rear of houses. Alleys may be paved, or simply dirt tracks. A blind alley has no outlet at one end and is thus a cul-de-sac.

title: c.cats_uniform_(idolmaster)
body:
C.Cats Uniform is a costume from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]] worn by the members of [[houkago_climax_girls_(idolmaster)|Houkago Climax Girls ]]. It is associated with the song "Cat Squad".

All five members sport a [[frills|frilled]] [[baseball uniform]] with a [[neck bell]], [[animal_ear_headwear|cat ear headwear]], [[fangs]], [[cat_tail|cat tails]] with [[tail_bow|tail bows]], and [[paw shoes]].

[[Komiya Kaho]]'s version of the costume features a [[cat_ear_helmet|cat-eared]] [[baseball helmet]], [[paw gloves]], [[frilled wrist cuffs]], and a [[black_shirt|black]] [[turtleneck shirt]] beneath a [[vertical-striped_shirt|vertical-striped]] [[baseball jersey]] that is [[shirt_partially_tucked_in|partially tucked in]] to [[vertical-striped_shorts|vertical-striped]] [[frilled shorts]]. She wears [[white_socks|white]] [[loose socks]]. Often shown [[holding_baseball_bat|holding]] a [[baseball bat]].

[[Sonoda Chiyoko]]'s version of the costume features a [[cat_hat|cat-eared]] [[baseball cap]], an [[off shoulder]] [[baseball jersey]] with [[frilled_sleeves|frilled]] [[puffy short sleeves]] over a [[black_shirt|black]] [[sleeveless turtleneck]], [[striped_sweatband|striped]] [[sweatband|sweatbands]] on each wrist, a [[baseball mitt]] a [[frilled skirt]], a [[fluffy tail]], two [[frilled_thigh_strap|frilled]] [[thigh_strap|thigh straps]], and [[bandaid|bandaids]] on her [[bandaid_on_knee|right knee]] and [[bandaid_on_leg|left leg]]. She sports an [[alternate hairstyle]], which is a long, [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[low ponytail]] tied with a [[hair bow]] and curled [[sidelocks]].

[[Morino Rinze]]'s version of the costume features a  [[cat_ear_helmet|cat-eared]] [[baseball helmet]], [[black_gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[frilled_wrist_cuffs|frilled]] [[wrist cuffs]], and a [[black_shirt|black]] [[sleeveless_turtleneck|sleeveless]] [[turtleneck shirt]] beneath a [[sleeveless_shirt]] [[cropped_shirt|cropped]] [[vertical-striped_shirt|vertical-striped]] [[baseball jersey]] that has [[puffy detached sleeves]]. On the bottom half she wears [[black_shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike_shorts_under_skirt|underneath]] a [[high-low skirt]], and [[loose_socks|loose]] [[thighhighs]]. Often shown [[holding_baseball_bat|holding]] a [[baseball bat]]. She sports an [[alternate hairstyle]] and [[alternate hair length]] for this costume, which is a [[wolf cut]].

[[Saijo Juri]]'s version of the costume features a [[cat_hat|cat-eared]] [[backwards hat]], [[baseball mitt]], a [[cropped_shirt|cropped]] [[black_shirt|black]] [[turtleneck shirt]] with [[three-quarter sleeves]] that reveals her [[midriff]] beneath a [[vertical-striped_jacket|vertical-striped]] [[open jacket]] [[baseball jersey]] with a [[frilled shirt collar]], a singular [[striped_sweatband|striped]] [[sweatband]] around her right wrist, a singular [[frilled_wrist_cuffs|frilled]] [[wrist_cuffs|wrist cuff]] around her left wrist, [[black_shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] [[bike_shorts_under_shorts|underneath]] [[frilled shorts]], and [[blue_socks|blue]] [[loose socks]] underneath [[shin guards]].

[[Arisugawa Natsuha]]'s version of the costume features a [[cat_hat|cat-eared]] [[baseball cap]], a [[baseball mitt]], a [[fluffy tail]], a [[cropped_shirt|cropped]] [[vertical-striped_shirt|vertical-striped]] [[baseball jersey]] with [[frilled sleeves]] and is [[tied_shirt|tied at the front]] to expose her [[midriff]]. This is worn over a [[black shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], and she wears a singular [[frilled_wrist_cuffs|frilled]] [[wrist_cuffs|wrist cuff]] around her left wrist. She wears [[fishnets]] beneath [[vertical-striped_shorts|vertical-striped]] [[short shorts]] and she wears [[frilled thighhighs]] [[socks_over_fishnets|over them]]. She sports an [[alternate hairstyle]], which is a long, [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[low ponytail]] tied with a [[hair scrunchie]].

title: wa_lolita
body:
A fashion style that combines traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]] with [[Lolita fashion]]. It usually consists of a [[yukata]] (sometimes [[kimono]]) top and a [[skirt]], or the bottom half of the garment is altered to mimic the typical Lolita style.

The name originates from the reference to Japan as "The Land of Wa" (harmony).

For Chinese-inspired Lolita, see [[Qi Lolita]]. For Korean-inspired Lolita, see [[Jo Lolita]].

For Japanese maid outfits, see [[wa maid]].

h4. See also

title: rk62
body:
The [b]RK 62[/b] ([i]Rynnäkkökivääri 62[/i]) is an [[assault rifle]] manufactured by Valmet and "SAKO, Limited.":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SAKO] It is the standard issue infantry weapon of the [[finnish army|Finnish Defence Forces]]. The weapon was designed in 1962 and is based on the [[kalashnikov rifle|Kalashnikov]] design. The RK 62 mainly uses the same 7.62×39mm [[ammunition|cartridge]] as the [[AK-47]]. It has a three-pronged [[MUZZLE DEVICE|flash suppressor]], and a groove for a specially designed [[combat knife|knife]] [[bayonet]]. The [[gun]] also heavily influenced the Israeli [[IMI Galil]].

The RK 62 is considered a high quality AK variant. The biggest single improvement, apart from the overall receiver and barrel quality, are the [b]iron sights[/b]. While most AKs have the rear sight mounted on top of the gas piston housing on top of the receiver. In the RK 62 the rear sight is mounted on the rear of the receiver cover with tritium illuminated night-sights. The older model has a wooden buttstock instead of the more common metal tubular one. 

h4. See also
* [[KK 62]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Valmet M78/83]]
* [[Valmet M82]]

h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "Rk 62":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RK_62]

body:
Known as [b]Soul Unison[/b] in Japan, it is an ability of [[MegaMan.exe]] where he takes the appearance and abilities of other [[NetNavi]]s.

This tag also applies for the [https://megaman.fandom.com/wiki/Cross_System](Cross System) mechanic from [[mega man battle network 6|Battle Network 6]] as well as fan concepts.

title: megaman.exe
body:
One of the main protagonists from the [[Mega Man Battle Network (series)|]] series, a [[NetNavi]] operated by [[Lan Hikari (mega man)|]], later revealed [spoiler]to have been created with the DNA of [[Hub Hikari (mega man)|]], Lan's twin brother.[/spoiler]

Beyond just [[Battle Chip]]s, MegaMan.EXE possesses mechanisms that allows him to be versatile in combat while also changing his appearance, like Style Change, [[Double Soul (mega man)|Double Soul and Cross System]].

* [[Star Force Mega Man]]

title: princess_shokora
body:
The true ruler of the Golden Pyramid and the damsel in distress in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. Long ago she was peacefully laid to rest under the pyramid until the [[Golden Diva]], in her greed, took residence of the pyramid, all of its treasures and cursed the ruins, [spoilers]transforming Shokora into a [[black cat (wario land)|shape-shifting]] [[shop owner (wario land)|entity]][/spoilers].

She shares some design elements with [[Princess Peach]], having a golden [[crown]], [[blue eyes]], blue [[sphere earrings]], and a [[pink dress|pink]] [[long dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She also has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair|reddish hair]] (more [[pink hair|pinkish]] in the in-game sprite), wears golden [[bangle|bangles]] and [[pink gloves|pink]] [[elbow gloves]].

[spoiler]Depending on the ending the design Shokora will transform into will differ. In the worst ending she turns into a [[baby]], in the second worst ending she has Wario's [[man face|ugly face]], her second-best ending has her as the princess and her best ending reveals an older, more warrior-like princess with short hair. The second-best ending is seemingly her canonical look, as that's the look that got official art and appears in the newspaper at the beginning of the game. See asset #24265333 for a look at every form Shokora can take in the ending.[/spoiler]

The word Shokora derives from the French word for "Chocolate"

h4. Official Art

* !post #7517663

title: idolmaster
body:
Idolmaster (アイドルマスター, stylized as [i]iDOLM@STER [/i]) is a 2005 video game series by [[Namco]] (later [[Bandai Namco]]), originally released for the arcade and subsequently for multiple platforms including Xbox 360, PlayStation Portable, Nintendo DS, PS3, PS4, PS5, and PC. The game follows the career of a producer from the 765 Production studio handling ten young [[idol]]s.

Eventually adapted into mutliple manga, a 2007 mecha re-imagining by [[Sunrise (company)|]], [[Idolmaster Xenoglossia]], and a more faithful 2011 anime which precedes the events of [[Idolmaster 2]]. The series has also spawned four mobile game spinoffs that focus on new groups of idols ([[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]], [[Idolmaster Million Live!]], [[Idolmaster Side-M]], and [[Gakuen Idolmaster]]), as well as spinoffs featuring all branches, such as [[Idolmaster Poplinks]]. It has also spawned a HTML5 platform game spinoff, [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]], as well as a non-game VTuber spinoff in [[Idolmaster va-liv]].

title: houshou_marine_(summer)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]]. 

It consists of a [[red bikini|red]] [[string bikini]] [[halterneck]] [[bikini under clothes|worn under]] a [[black jacket|black]], [[partially unzipped]] [[hooded jacket]] [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts|short]]  [[dolphin shorts]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]], an [[ankle strap]] [[gladiator sandals]], a [[black hat|black]] [[baseball cap]] and [[heart-shaped eyewear|heart-shaped]] [[sunglasses]]. A week after her third outfit debut, Marine revealed a variant with unzipped jacket, a [[wet]] [[see-through shirt|see-through]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]]. This was actually a compromise to comply with YouTube's guidelines.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

* [[Very long hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]]
* Very long hair tied in [[twintails]] held with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s
* Very long [[straight hair]] with [[sidelocks]]

title: cross
body:
A symbol or object that consists of two intersecting perpendicular lines, with one or both lines divided in half by the intersection.

Ancient religions used the cross as a symbol of the sun. Christianity uses it as a symbol representing the cross on which Jesus was crucified.

This tag refers to any cross-shaped symbol or physical object.

h4. Related tags

h6. Basic Shapes

* [[Greek Cross]] (A cross with 4 equal length arms, + symbol)
* [[Latin Cross]] (A cross with with a longer descending arm, † symbol)
* [[Saltire]] (A diagonal cross, x symbol) 

h6.  Combined Shapes

* [[Sun Cross]] (A Greek cross inside a circle)
* [[Celtic Cross]] (A Greek or Latin cross with a circle overlaid)

h6. Cross End Shapes (combines with the basic shapes)

* [[Arrow Cross]] (Arrow ends)
* [[Cross Bottony]] (Trefoil or club ends)
* Cross Crosslet (Cross ends)
* [[Cross Fitchy]] (Descending arm ends with a point)
* [[Cross Fleury]] ([[fleur-de-lis|Fleur-de-lis]] ends)
* [[Cross Moline]] (Ends split into two and curve back)
* [[Cross Potent]] (Crossbar ends)
* [[Cross Patonce]] (Intermediate of Patty and Fleury ends, splits into 3 and leaf shaped)
* [[Cross Patty]] (Wide ends that narrow toward the center)

h6. Cross Positioning and Scale

* [[Inverted Cross]]
* [[Large Cross]]

h6. Cross Symbols

* [[Balkenkreuz]]  (a Greek cross with an outline)
* [[Two-Barred Cross]] (cross with two horizontal bars, also known as the cross of lorraine or patriarchal cross)
* [[Crucifix]] (a Latin cross with [[Jesus]] affixed to it)
* [[Orthodox Cross]] (similar to a Latin cross with a smaller bar crossing above the the central cross and a smaller slanted cross on the base arm)
* [[Iron Cross]] (a Greek cross with cross patty ends)
* [[Maltese cross]] (an eight-pointed cross made from four inward-pointing V shapes)
* [[Red Cross]] (a red Greek cross)
* [[Swastika]] (an equilateral cross with arms that are bent 90 degrees)

h6. Other Crosses

* [[Cross of Saint Andrew]] (For physical saltire cross used for crucifixion)
* [[Crosier]] (A staff topped with a cross)
* [[Crux (constellation)|]] (A cross-shaped constellation)

title: applying_bandaid
body: A [[bandaid]] is in the process of being placed on a character/object, or is being held in a manner that implies it is about to be placed.

title: bandaid_pull
body: A [[bandaid]] is being pulled from a character's skin or the surface of an object. Visual indicators that the bandaid is being pulled rather than [[applying bandaid|applied]] include if a tip of the otherwise applied bandaid is being held up [[between fingers]] and/or if the character is showing noticeable discomfort such as [[wince|wincing]] in [[pain]].

title: roland_(project_moon)
body:
One of [[Library of Ruina]]'s main characters.

Based off of the 11th century poem "Song of Roland":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Song_of_Roland], with further inspiration from the 15th and 16th century epic poems "Orland Innamorato":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Innamorato and "Orlando Furioso":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orlando_Furioso. He differs from his inspirations by being married to [[Angelica (project moon)|]].

He wears intentionally basic clothes, consisting of a [[suit]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] and [[black necktie]]. Before his arrival to the Library, he wore a [[black mask]] that blocked people's perception of who he was.

title: yagami_light
body:
Main character of the [[Death Note]] anime and manga series. Light is a highly intelligent high school student who gets his hands on a [[Death Note (object)|]] dropped into the human world by a [[shinigami]], and decides to use it to change the world, becoming the vigilante killer known as "Kira" and coming into conflict with both the law enforcement of the world and the mysterious detective known only as [[L (Death Note)|L]].

He is quite known for his '[[Just as Planned (meme)|]]' look and 'The [[God of the New World (meme)|]]' expression which gained [[meme]] status.

h4.External links
* "Wikipedia: Light Yagami":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Light_Yagami

title: gouri_daisuke

Daisuke Gōri (February 8, 1952 – January 17, 2010) was a Japanese [[voice actor]], narrator and actor from Kōtō, Tokyo. Tragically, Gouri took his own life in 2010. It is believed that career-ending health issues contributed to his decision.

title: usada_pekora_(10th_costume)
body:
The 10th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Usada Pekora]].

It's a [[jiangshi costume]] consisting of a [[blue hat|blue]] [[qingdai guanmao]], a [[detached collar|detached]] [[mandarin collar]], a [[short dress|short]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[frilled dress]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[blue sleeves]] [[detached sleeves]] [[sleeves past fingers|reaching past her fingers]], a [[thighlet]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[platform shoes]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this outfit, she has her [[very long hair|very long]] [[blue hair]] tied into held [[double bun|double]] [[braided bun|braided]] [[side up bun]]s that turn into [[twintails]].

Unlike other costumes, [[Don-chan (usada pekora)|]] appears as a [[ghost]] in this costume.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8661409: Profile
* !post #8661422: Reference sheet

In this outfit, she wears a [[white shirt]] (which sometimes can be a [[see-through shirt]]), worn over a [[blue bikini|blue]] [[frilled bikini]] with a [[bikini skirt]], a [[thigh strap]] and [[white sandals]].

title: usada_pekora_(pekoland_princess)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Usada Pekora]], which debuted on her birthday in 2023.

It consists of a [[tiara]], a [[fur collar]], a [[skirt set]] consisting of a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[gold trim]] and a [[white skirt|white]] [[high-low skirt|high-low]] [[overskirt]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]] worn over a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[bubble skirt|bubble]] [[miniskirt]], [[white gloves|white]] [[frilled gloves]], [[white thighhighs]] with [[white garter straps]] and [[yellow shoes|golden]] [[mary janes]]. She also has an optional [[white shrug|white]] [[shrug (clothing)|]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and an [[orange sash|orange]] [[shoulder sash]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit, she has her [[very long hair]] tied into [[twintails]].

h4. Appearance

title: usada_pekora_(furi_furi_bunny_dress)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Usada Pekora]].

Her 5th costume, which she calls her [b]Frilly Bunny Dress[/b] ([i]Furi Furi Bunny Dress[/i] in Japanese), consists of a [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[black hat|black]] [[mini top hat]], a two-tone [[rabbit mask]] that changes expressions, a [[short dress|short]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[black dress]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[backless dress]] with [[center frills]], a [[detached collar]] with a [[short necktie|short]] [[black necktie]], either [[white sleeves|white]] or [[black sleeves|black]] [[puffy detached sleeves|detached]] [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[wrist cuffs]], [[rabbit paws|rabbit]] [[paw gloves]], a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]], a [[black skirt|black]] or [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] with a [[see-through skirt layer|see-though layer]] underneath, [[frilled thighhighs|frilled]] [[fishnet thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[strappy heels]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Medium hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[blunt bangs]]
* [[Long hair|Long]] [[straight hair]] with [[sidelocks]]
She also wears a [[black hairband|hairband]] with black ear covers that [[rabbit ear hairband|allegedly]] have her "real" rabbit ears inside.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5906890: Profile
* !post #5906891: Reference sheet

兎田ぺこら(フリフリバニードレス)

title: usada_pekora_(casual)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Usada Pekora]].

Her casual attire consists of a [[white choker]], a [[white dress|white]] [[short dress|short]] [[sailor dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[blue jacket|blue]], [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[denim jacket]], a [[white sailor collar]], a [[blue neckerchief]] a [[white belt]], [[white socks]] and [[blue shoes|blue]] [[sneakers]]. Curiously, her rabbit ears were tied together akin to that of a [[ribbon]], which leads to fans jokingly called it fake ears, despite Pekora's insistence that her human ears were simply a dummy used to "blend in with human society".

On May 31, 2023, she got an updated version of this attire that adds an optional  [[brown cardigan|light brown]] [[cable knit]] [[hooded cardigan]] with [[cross-laced sleeves]] and a [[rabbit hood]]. Her [[rabbit ears]] can be untied now too.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this attire are:

* [[Long hair|Long]] [[wavy hair]] in a [[two side up]] held with [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]]s, [[swept bangs]] decorated with [[carrot hair ornament|carrot-shaped]] [[hairclip]]s and [[sidelocks]]
* [[Short hair|Short]]/[[medium hair|medium]] also in a [[two side up]] with the hairclips near the pigtails rather than the bangs
* [[long hair|Long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[parted hair]] in a [[two side up]] with [[pom pom hair ornament]]s with [[blunt bangs]] and long [[sidelocks]] going [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulders]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6357675: Profile (with rabbit hood)
* !post #4989890: Profile (without rabbit hood)
* !post #5516247: Merchandise

title: houshou_marine_(marching_band)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]],, unveiled on her 2022 birthday stream. Entitled "Captain Marine 3D Misoji Edition" in the concept art, misoji being romaji for 'thirty years old' (三十路), it is a marching band-styled costume.

It consists of a [[plume]]d [[shako cap]], a [[gold trim|gold-trimmed]] [[two-sided jacket]] ([[black jacket|black]] on the outside, red on the inside), a [[black leotard|black]] [[lace-trimmed leotard|lace-trimmed]] [[strapless leotard]] worn over a black [[bodystocking]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[underbust]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[showgirl skirt]], and [[black boots|black]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[thigh boots]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[very long hair|very long]] with and [[grey hair|grey]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] into an  [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical hairstyle]] with a [[single side bun|single]] [[side up bun]] on one side and a [[one side up]] on the other.

title: inkling
body:
A species of humanoid cephalopods in the [[Splatoon (series)|]] series that can transform into [[inkling_(swim_form)|squids]] and back to their humanoid form at will.

Use this species tag for any of the following characters, as long as they aren't depicted as an [[alternate species]] (e.g. a full-on human / [[humanization]]):

h4. Characters

* [b][[Inkling player character]][/b]
** [[Inkling Girl]]
** [[Inkling Boy]]
* [b]Idols[/b]
** [[Callie (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Marie (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Pearl (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Frye (Splatoon)|]]
* [b][[Squidbeak Splatoon]] (story mode cast)[/b]
** Agent 1 (Callie)
** Agent 2 (Marie)
** [[Agent 3 (Splatoon)|]], player character for Splatoon 1's hero mode.
** [[Agent 4 (Splatoon)|]], player character for Splatoon 2's hero mode.
** [[Agent 3 (Splatoon 3)|New Agent 3]], player character for Splatoon 3's hero mode. Can also be an [[Octoling]].
** [[Cap'n Cuttlefish]]
* [b]Other Inklings[/b] (WIP)
** [[Ichiya (splatoon)|]]
** [[Nami (splatoon)|]]
** [[Quinn (splatoon)|]]
** [[Clash (splatoon)|]]
** [[Jessika (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Yoko (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Baker (splatoon)|]]
** [[Lionel (splatoon)|]]


[b]Identifying [[Inkling]]s (as opposed to [[Octoling]]s)[/b]

Inklings have a few key traits that Octolings don't:
* [[pointy ears]]
* a black line that connects their eyes. these were designed to give Inklings a mask-like appearance, similar to that of a [[domino mask]].
* their [[suction cups]] appear within the [i]inside[/i] of their [[tentacle hair]] (e.g. post #6122993)
* sometimes depicted with [[star-shaped pupils]] (e.g. post #7316406)
** (the named Inklings, particularly the Idols, are nearly always depicted with them)
* unique hairstyles, see "this list of them (Splatoon wiki).":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Player_Settings#Inkling]
** [[Inkling girl]]s have some longer hairstyle options than [[Octoling girl]]s

post #7190600 is a good comparison of these traits, with an Inkling on the left and an Octoling on the right

Typical tags common to both Inklings and Octolings include [[tentacle hair]] and [[thick eyebrows]].

Note: Inklings do not usually have [[cephalopod eyes]] despite being based off Squid. Splatoon reserves those for Octolings, particularly the named Idol Octolings. post #4589127 is a very rare example of an Inkling drawn with cephalopod eyes

title: octoling
body:
A species of humanoid cephalopods in the [[Splatoon (series)|]] series that can transform into [[octoling_(swim_form)|octopi]] and back to their humanoid form at will.

They are a type of "Octarian":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Octarian], and are initially introduced as the main antagonist species of [[Splatoon 1]]. [[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion]] had the first appearance of them as a protagonist in the form of [[Agent 8 (Splatoon)|]]. In [[Splatoon 2]], they are unlockable playable main characters for the multiplayer modes and [[Salmon Run (Splatoon)|]] upon beating Octo Expansion. [[Splatoon 3]] lets you be one from the start. Thus Splatoon 3's base game story mode protagonist, [[Agent 3 (Splatoon 3)]], can be either an Inkling or an Octoling. 

The player can choose from an [[Octoling Boy]] or an [[Octoling Girl]].

Use this species tag for any of the following characters, as long as they aren't depicted as an [[alternate species]] (e.g. a full-on human / [[humanization]]):

h4. Characters

* [b][[Octoling player character]][/b]
** [[Octoling Girl]]
** [[Octoling Boy]]
* [b]Idols[/b]
** [[Marina (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Shiver (Splatoon)|]]
* [b][[Squidbeak Splatoon]] (story mode cast)[/b]
** [[Agent 8 (Splatoon)|]], player character for both [[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion]] and [[Splatoon 3: Side Order]].
** [[Agent 3 (Splatoon 3)|New Agent 3]], player character for Splatoon 3's hero mode. Can also be an [[Inkling]].
* [b]Other Octolings[/b] (WIP)
** [[Dedf1sh]]
** [[DJ Octavio]]
** [[Paul (splatoon)|]]
** [[Mashup (splatoon)|Mashup]]
** [[Hachi (splatoon)|]]
** [[Tao Blu (splatoon)|]]

h6. Identifying [[Octoling]]s (as opposed to [[Inkling]]s)

Octolings have a few key traits that Inklings don't:
* rounded ears as opposed to Inklings' [[pointy ears]]
* no black line that connects their eyes like Inklings
* their suction cups appear on the [i]outside[/i] of their [[tentacle hair]] (e.g. post #7028055)
* sometimes depicted with [[cephalopod eyes]] (e.g. post #7464499 - the figure-8 shaped horizontal pupils)
** (the named Octolings, particularly the Idols, are nearly always depicted with them)
* unique hairstyles, see "this list of them (Splatoon wiki)":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Player_Settings#Octoling]
** [[mohawk]], [[afro]] and [[short ponytail]] are some examples that are used for Octolings as opposed to Inklings.

Post #7190600 is a good comparison of these traits, with an Inkling on the left and an Octoling on the right.

Typical tags common to both Inklings and Octolings include [[tentacle hair]] and [[thick eyebrows]].

title: acguy
body:
A fictional manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV anime series from 1979.

[b]MSM-04 Acguy[/b]

One of [[Zeon]]'s earliest ampihibous [[mobile_suit|MS]] designs. The large-bodied Acguy possessed a powerful generator capable of driving a mega particle [[beam cannon]], aided by the fact that being underwater helped with cooling. It attained lasting fame for being oddly [[moe (phrase)|adorable]], usually being compared to [[beargguy|a teddy bear]] due to its round form and brown colors. [spoilers]Also because of its weirdly shaped head, which many an [[otaku]] thought looked like a [[dildo]], hence the popularity of the double entendre phrase [i]"Acguy is love"[/i].[/spoilers]

h4. Related development
* [[Aggjin]]

title: euphonium
body:
[b]Euphonium[/b] (from the Greek word [i]εὔφωνος[/i], meaning "well-sounding" or "sweet-voiced") is a conical-bore, baritone-voiced brass [[instrument]]. The euphonium is a valved instrument; nearly all current models are piston valved, though rotary valved models do exist.

A person who plays the euphonium is sometimes called a [i]euphoniumist[/i], [i]euphophonist[/i], or a [i]euphonist[/i], while British players often colloquially refer to themselves as [i]euphists[/i], or [i]euphologists[/i]. Similarly, the instrument itself is often referred to as [i]eupho[/i] or [i]euph[/i].

Visually, the euphonium may have a similar appearance to its better known cousin, the [[tuba]] (depending on its design), the difference being the former is slightly smaller and has a slightly higher pitch than the latter.

h4.Examples
* !post #5540267
* !post #3615013

h4. See also
* [[tuba]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

h4. External links

* "[i]Wikipedia[/i] article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euphonium]

title: tuba
body:
The largest and lowest pitched brass [[instrument]]. Tubas vary in size and pitch. With vertically coiled tubing in an oblong shape, and a bell pointing upward or forward. It normally has three or four valves (sometimes even more) and a wide conical bore.

* !post #7831953

title: gaplant_hrairoo
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It first appeared in [[Advance of Zeta]].

[b]ORX-005 Gaplant TR-5 [Hrairoo][/b]

A customized variant of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[Gaplant]] meant to be used for testing purposes. The type's excessive stress on pilots was alleviated by removing the shoulder binders, which would later be reattached once the unit was deemed fit to be piloted by less exceptional physical specimens. 

As with many other Titans Test Team [[mobile_suit|MS]], it would be repainted in a white and grey scheme and receive provisions for a multitude of optional attachments - chief among them the gigantic [Fiver] hypersonic assault unit, which this type would serve as the core of.

title: sesshoumaru
body:
Sesshōmaru is a major antagonist-turned-anti-hero in the manga and anime series [[Inuyasha]].

He wears a [[fur shawl]] and has a [[crescent facial mark]] on his [[forehead mark|forehead]].

He is a powerful dog daiyōkai who is feared throughout the feudal world, the half-brother of the [[inuyasha (character)|hanyō Inuyasha]] and the first son to the Inu no Taishō, their father.

Voiced by [[Narita Ken]].

title: large_pectorals
body:
When the [[pectorals]] tag is not enough and the chest is noticeably larger. Frequently with [[muscular male]]s.
As a rule of thumb, use this tag if the pectoral muscle looks about the same or greater in diameter as the character's facial area.

Use with the [[toned male]] tag in cases of characters with [[large pectorals]] or [[manboobs]] but non-bulky overall build.

h4. Examples: 

* !post #2986416: Slightly raised but not manboobs just large. 
* !post #6646548: Pecs should be larger than the face to qualifier for large pectorals. 

Pectorals: post #4312854, post #4338786, post #4307507 post #4165068
Manboobs: post #4071939, post #3372363

h4. Related tags

* [[pectorals]]
* [[alternate pectoral size]]

title: manboobs
body:
For fatty or breast-like looking [[pectorals]]. Sometimes with puffy or raised nipples.

 Although this condition is normally found on [[fat_man|overweight men]] (post #6115619), it is also a fetish name used for slimmer men with [[male_with_breasts|feminine breasts]] (post #5044172, post #5025833) or muscular men with defined and round [[pectorals]] (post #4072298,  post #4123358). 

Do not tag with [[muscular male]] or [[toned male]] unless the body is viable and proportional with the chest size. Otherwise just the [[manboobs]] tag will suffice.

* !post #5488282: Pectorals squeezed together to form manboobs. 
* !post #6115619: Overweight natural manboobs.

title: puffy_chest
body:
When a bare male chest has the appearance of a pubescent female chest. Visually similar to [[flat chest]], often used to feminize male characters. If the character has actual female anatomy in the chest area use [[male with breasts]]

* !post #2653111: Puffy chest and nipple, not full breasts. 
* !post #7681677: Slight curves give the suggestion of breasts but still not female anatomy.

title: duryodhana_(fate)
body:
A Berserker-class servant first appearing in the [[Paper Moon (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. One of the major characters of the Mahabharata as the eldest of the Hundred Princes that opposed the Five Princes. Ultimately died in a duel against [[Bhima (fate)|]], trusting [[Ashwatthama (fate)|]] to carry on his will.

title: looking_afar
body:
When a character is looking off into the distance. Can be used with [[looking ahead]] when the character's gaze is seen to be directed straight ahead, but not at a subject that is visible in the image close-by (ie. an object or person in the same room).

h4. Examples
* !post #4225016: character is facing away from the viewer, looking into the distance
* !post #2406093: character is [[looking ahead]] into the distance

title: rx-78-2_gundam
body:
[b]RX-78-2 Gundam[/b]

The original Gundam [[Mobile Suit]] from the series [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. Together with the [[Guntank]] and the [[Guncannon]], it is the final mobile suit of the [[Earth Federation]]'s [b]Project V[/b]. It also serves as the [[Gundam]] franchise's mascot. It is piloted by the series' protagonist, [[Amuro Ray]]. 

Extremely powerful and resilient (thanks to its experimental [i]Luna Titanium Alloy[/i] or [i]Gundarium[/I]), it is equipped with an advanced A.I. system that improves the combat abilities of its [[pilot]]. The model was designed by [[Tem Ray]] specifically to counter the threat of [[Zeon]]'s standard mobile suits, most notably the [[Zaku II]].

Visually, the RX-78-2 has a white, red, blue, and yellow color scheme. It also has a white [[V-fin]] on its head unit, and is often seen carrying a couple of [[energy sword]]s, a [[shield]] and a powerful [[beam rifle]]. Not to be confused with the [[Gundam Mk II]], [[Strike Gundam]], [[Ground Gundam]], or [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]].

In real life it was designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]] and refined by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]] in the late 70s (Yasuhiko designed the Gundam's face mask and color scheme.)

The first Gundam was inspired by [[Mazinger Z (mecha)]] and the [[power armor]]s from [[Starship Troopers]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15913377

h4. See also

* RX-78-1 "[[Prototype Gundam]]" ([[Gundam MSV]])

body:
An unattractive man, often [[old man|old]], [[bald]] and/or [[fat man|overweight]].

In Japanese NSFW works, they are usually used as a "self-insert" device character, and being paired with younger or more attractive women, either through [[rape]] or [[prostitution]]. This character type is prevalent in the [[netorare]] genre.

title: king_k._rool
body:
Main antagonist of the [i][[Donkey Kong (series)|]][/i] series, introduced in the original [i][[Donkey Kong Country]][/i]. He is the leader of the Kremlings, a race of [[crocodilian]]s that constantly antagonize [[Donkey Kong]] and the Kong Family. 

His most distinctive physical trait is his single [[bloodshot_eyes|bloodshot eye]]. In his default [b]King[/b] persona he dons a gold [[crown]], a [[red cape]] with a [[brooch]], and golden [[bracer]]s. However he is known to adopt other personas such as [b]Kaptain K. Rool[/b] where he wears a [[pirate]] look with a [[pirate hat]] carrying a [[blunderbuss]], [b]Baron K. Roolenstein[/b] where he adopts a [[mad scientist]], [[frankenstein's_monster|frankenstein]]-like look with a [[lab coat]], and [b]King Krusha K. Rool[/b] where he takes on the look of a boxer with [[boxing gloves]] and a [[championship belt]]. 

His name is a pun on "cruel". Colloquially it is commonly pronounced as "King Kay Rool" in English speaking countries as well as officially in [i][[Super Smash Bros.]] Ultimate[/i]. The television show usually pronounced his name as "King Kuh Rool". In Japanese it's pronounced as "King Cruel".

h4. Appearance
* !post #3217762: Default
* !asset #25563218: Kaptain K. Rool
* !asset #25563220: Baron K. Roolenstein
other_names: キング"クラッシャー"クルール

title: vanguard_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] battleship HMS [i]Vanguard[/i] (23). Character design by [[Ask (askzy)|]], voiced by [[Nakashima Yuki]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[white cape]] with green inside color, white [[thighhighs]], [[black footwear]], black [[hair ribbon]], and [[black gloves]]. Her [[rigging]] is a large and elaborate setup akin to the French factions, sporting her four historical 381 mm twin gun mounts and two 13.3 cm twin DP secondary mounts.

From her voice lines, she is implied to be an [[otaku]], made more apparent with "her gacha build obtain animation":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=smcvah3Sqp8] that resembles a [i]mahou shoujo[/i] transformation sequence. 

In real life, [i]Vanguard[/i] was the Royal Navy's largest and fastest battleship (45,000 tons and 30 knots), but was the last British battleship built and commissioned. She was built to a modified [i]Lion[/i]-class design meant to take in Courageous' and [[Glorious (Azur Lane)|]]' original 381 mm guns in storage to expedite construction. She was launched in 1944, commissioned in 1946, and sold for scrap in 1960.



h4. Skins
* !post #6008198: Default
* !post #5383063: [[Vanguard (Half-Hearted Masquerade) (Azur Lane)|Half-Hearted Masquerade]]

* [[Vanguard (Warship Girls R)]]

* "Wikipedia: HMS [i]Vanguard[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Vanguard_(23)]

title: queen_draco_(fate)
body:
Beast-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]]. Initially appears as an [[aged down]] version of [[Nero Claudius (Fate/Extra)|]], but this is considered her immature state. Her mature form is referred to as [b][[queen draco (beast vi/s) (fate)|Beast VI/S]][/b], with the S representing "Sodom":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sodom_and_Gomorrah.

The immature form of Queen Draco can be obtained as a welfare SSR Alter Ego Servant - as of this writing, the only five-star rarity welfare Servant throughout all of FGO and FGOA. She is later introduced into the mobile game as a summonable Beast-class Servant, making her the first playable Beast in the entire franchise, with a unique summoning animation included. The character card for the Beast class uses her matured Beast VI/S form as the representative.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]] (Draco), [[Yamanaka Kotetsu]] ([[Queen Draco (Beast VI/S) (fate)|Beast VI/S]])
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tange Sakura]]

title: no_(gesture)
body:
Gestures used to decline, reject, or otherwise tell the other party to stop.

h4. Examples

* !post #9872: "Iya iya iya" gesture. Waving the arm across the face, a Japanese gesture to mean "no" or "not right."
* !post #9162212: (Top right) "Cut it out" gesture, a [[slit_throat_(gesture)|slit throat gesture]] using the tips of the fingers across the neck.
* !post #7984503: (Top left) "Pass" gesture. Holding out a palm and turning the head away.
* !post #8781942: "Halt" gesture. Holding both palms out, may be combined with waving the hands.

title: solo
body:
An image containing a single person. No one else should be visible in the image.

That means only one copy of the character. These situations [b]should not be tagged solo[/b]:

* Single characters being depicted from [[multiple views]] (post #12904)
* [[dakimakura (medium)|]] which contain [[multiple views]]
* [[dual persona]]
* [[time paradox]]

These situations should be tagged [[solo focus]], [b]not solo[/b]:

* Pictures focusing on one character among a crowd of nondescript, less detailed [[people]].
* Single characters engaged in [[tag group:sex acts|sex acts]] with [[faceless]] or [[out of frame]] characters.

Situations that can be solo include:

* A single character with one or more inanimate [[doll]]s or [[photo_(object)|]]s of other characters.
* A single character with [b]unnamed[/b] pet or object characters. Images involving animals or creatures with a character tag (talking or otherwise) alongside another character should not be tagged solo.

h4. See also

* [[1boy]]
* [[1girl]]
* [[1other]]
* [[solo focus]]

title: nugget_(pokemon)
body:
A Nugget (Japanese:きんのたま Gold Orb) is an item in the [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] series. Nuggets are solid chunks of gold that are hidden in usually difficult locations because of their worth.

title: fairy_(kancolle)
body:
The [[minigirl]]s who appear in the equipment cards (and presumably operate them) in [[Kantai Collection]].

Several of them, especially the more recent ones, are [[look-alike]]s of certain ship girls, as they represent their signature equipment. For example, the fairies of the Type 32 Surface Radar Kai "resemble Ise and Hyuuga":/posts/2044610. Alternatively, the Skilled Lookouts fairies "resemble Ayanami and Choukai":/posts/2200303.

h4. Fairies

h6. Port Fairies

* [[maintenance musume (kancolle)|Maintenance Musume]]
* [[helmet musume (kancolle)|Helmet Musume]]
* [[furniture fairy (kancolle)|Furniture Fairy]]

h6. Equipment Fairies

* [[anti-torpedo bulge (kancolle)|Anti-Torpedo Bulge]]
* [[combat ration (kancolle)|Combat Ration]] ([[kappougi]], dark green hair, half updo)
* [[Daihatsu Landing Craft]]
* [[Damage Control Crew (kancolle)|Damage Control Crew]]
* [[Damage Control Goddess (kancolle)|Damage Control Goddess]]
* [[drum canister (kancolle)|Drum Canister]] (pink hair, sailor cap)
* [[Fleet Command Facility]] (Ooyodo lookalikes)
* [[M4A1 DD]] (blonde hair, olive green helmet)
* [[searchlight (kancolle)|Searchlight]] (green hair, ponytail)
* [[Type 96 150cm Searchlight]] (Hiei, Kirishima, and Yamato lookalikes)
* [[ship repair facility (kancolle)|Ship Repair Facility]] (helmets, yellow uniform, blue and green hair)
* [[Skilled Carrier-Based Aircraft Maintenance Personnel]] (blue hair, ponytail, low ponytail)
* [[skilled lookouts (kancolle)|Skilled Lookouts]] (Ayanami and Choukai lookalikes)

* Large

title: type_2_seaplane_fighter_fairy
body:
A seaplane version of the famous [[A6M Zero]], known as "Rufe" from the Allied code, represented by the [[kantai collection|KanColle]] character.

This seaplane retains the abilites of the A6M zero, but with a few capabilities which can reach high altitudes and intercept enemies from both sky and sea. Like the Zero, it also can carry bombs. This seaplane fighter is designed from Nakajima.

title: type_0_fighter_model_21_fairy
body:
The [[Kantai Collection]] [[fairy (kancolle)|fairy]] that pilots the namesake aircraft in-game. For the actual historical aircraft, see [[A6M Zero]].

The Type 0 Fighter Model 21 fairy is a [[chibi]] figure with [[short_hair|short]] [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[blue hair]]. She wears a [[plaid scarf]], [[green jacket]], [[green skirt]], [[boots]] and [[goggles_on_head|goggles on her head]]. She is accompanied by a [[bird]].
